channel.title: Posts on Anecdotal Evidence
channel.description: Recent content in Posts on Anecdotal Evidence

item.title: #TidyTuesday Week 37: NYC Restaurant Inspections
item.description: Week 2! Again, I found the most difficult part of this process to be diving into a random set of data and trying to pull out something interesting. Toss me some baseball or political data, and I have an idea of the questions I want to ask, but data on NYC restaurant inspections is a little trickier. In the NYC Restaurant Inspections data each row is a unique inspection/violation - so one restaurant may have multiple records from the same date, but with different violations.

item.title: The Color of Law by Richard Rothstein
item.description: The Color of Law starts by presenting a series of Supreme Court decisions that cemented and popularized the myth of de facto segregation, not just in American jurisprudence, but in our culture. Rothstein points to opinions from Justice Potter Stewart in 1974, Justice Anthony Kennedy in 1992, and finishes with this quote from a Chief Justice John Roberts in 2007: “Where [racial imbalance] is a product not of state action but of private choices, it does not have constitutional implications.

item.title: #TidyTuesday Week 36: Medium Blog Posts
item.description: So my first attempt at a #TidyTuesday - it’s not quite as easy as DRob makes it look! The data on Medium blog posts was interesting and in good shape, but for my first #TidyTuesday post I had a bit of a brain cramp generating ideas. I’ve been listening to a podcast lately that talks about the importance of a consistent posting schedule for bloggers, so I tried to dig into the relationship between an author’s posting schedule and the number of claps they receive.

item.title: 2017 Reading List
item.description: Strangers in Their Own Land by Arlie Russell Hochschild The Undoing Project by Michael Lewis What it Takes by Richard Ben Cramer Midnight Riot by Ben Aaronovitch Just Mercy by Bryan Stevenson Moon Over Soho by Ben Aaronovitch Data Science for Business by Foster Provost and Tom Fawcett The Unwinding by George Packer Whispers Underground by Ben Aaronovitch Hillbilly Elegy by J.

item.title: 2018 Reading List
item.description: The Three-Body Problem by Cixin Liu, trans. by Ken Liu Shoe Dog: A Memoir by the Creator of Nike by Phil Knight Killers of the Flower Moon: The Osage Murders and the Birth of the FBI by David Grann Gnomon by Nick Harkaway The Ocean at the End of the Lane by Neil Gaiman The Catcher in the Rye by J.D. Salinger Siddhartha by Herman Hesse The Ministry of Utmost Happiness by Arundhati Roy
